Kings XI Punjab have relieved David Miller from captaincy duties and been replaced by India Test opener Murali Vijay.

cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: 11 on 11: India defeat Pakistan at Eden, 11 WC matches, 11 wins)
cricket_live_blog.title: 11 on 11: India defeat Pakistan at Eden, 11 WC matches, 11 wins

details.content_title: Virat Kohli once again proved he was the most valuable player for the team. India battled against immense pressure to win against Pakistan today. Expect some fireworks from this Indian team from now. That's all we have for you tonight. Good night folks.
In this format every team is a good team. We want to compete. We want to be here for the final, but as of now we want to take one game at a time: Dhoni
I didn't expect it to spin so much. The spinners got plenty of help out there. It got slightly better in the second half and they had only one spinner. I think we can still do better: MS Dhoni
Pakistan should learn to handle pressure from India: Afridi

First of all, I want to congratulate Dhoni and his team for playing well. I did not expect the pitch to spin so much, but no excuse. I think we didn't score enough runs. We were short by 30-35 runs. Their spinners bowled well. I think we didn't bowl in the right areas and I didn't bowl well. Virat Kohli played an awesome innings: Afridi

Yuvraj came out, weathered the storm and smacked a few. It's great for him that he came out in a pressure situation. He's feeling confident. I think a score on the board always helps me calculate better: Kohli

It was a challenging wicket out there. You need new challenges every innings that you play. I was disappointed that I got out for about 25 in the last game. I knew if I had scored 40-45 we could have won. That really hurt because we don't bat like that at home. Today it was all about keeping calm and luckily I got a great partnership with Yuvraj: Kohli

Well played India. Class run chase in tough conditions. Something for the rest of the competition to learn from! Good night all!

— Glenn Maxwell (@Gmaxi_32) March 19, 2016

It's a delighted @imVkohli who gets the Player of the Match and shares the #TwitterMirror with the #IND fans! #WT20 pic.twitter.com/Xj7HpYPG0A

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
Virat Kohli is the Man of the Match
15.5 overs: INDIA WIN BY SIX WICKETs as Dhoni completes an easy single. India have now won all their five World T20 matches vs Pakistan.
15.4 overs: SIX! Dhoni smashes Irfan in the stands. India have drawn level. India are almost there. This is sensational stuff.
15.2 overs: FOUR! Kohli smashes a poor delivery from Irfan- short and it was duly punished by Kohli. India are on the verge of a big win
14.3 overs: Kohli brings up his 14th fifty off 34 balls. What a knock this has been by the Indian star. Akram heaps praise on the Indian run-machine
14.2 overs: FOUR! Kohli executes another cover drive . India are racing towards a win
14 overs: Top, top shot by Kohli off Amir, as India reach 99/4, chasing 119
13.1 overs: Amir back in the attack. He will have to make the difference here.
12.1 overs: Afridi back in the attack and FOUR! Cracking cover drive from Kohli, That was right in the slot to be hit.
12 overs: WICKET! Yuvraj falls to Wahab for 24 as India reach 84/4, chasing 119. But Kohli is looking great in the middle and India are still in with a great chance
11.2 overs: Risky shot from Yuvraj but it results in a single and brings Kohli back on strike
11.1 overs: SIX! Yuvraj has joined the party, he sends Wahab crashing into the stands. The Eden has erupted. India are eyeing an easy win here
10.5 overs: FOUR! Kohli is turning this game around for India; he has brought up his 50-run partnership with Yuvraj Singh.
10.2 overs: SIX! Kohli blasts Malik into the stands. India now need less than 50 to win this one. What a moment it would be at the Eden Gardens
9.2 overs: Sensible batting by Kohli. All Yuvraj needs to do is stay on at the other end. There's still plenty of batting to come for India. They should be able to win it from here
9.1 overs: FOUR! Kohli greets Riaz into the attack with a good-looking shot and the Eden erupts.
9.1 overs: Wahab Riaz in the attack for Pakistan with India 54/3, half-way into the innings
8.3 overs: Kohli plays Malik away for a single as India bring up their 50 in the ninth over
8.1 overs: Malik in the attack. Spin will be key for Pakistan here
8 overs: Sensible from Yuvraj and Kohli. They are not taking risks now and are managing to get 4-5 runs an over. IND 46/3
7.3 overs: Afridi puts a slip for Kohli. The Indian batsmen nudges this one in the gap and gets a single.
7.1 overs: Yuvraj gets a single off Afridi's first ball. Kohli is the key man for India. He is a busy player who can keep the required run-rate at check

Whosoever said the Nagpur pitch 'misbehaved' has to be at the Eden Gardens tonight #IndvsPak #WT20 #superhitmuqabala

— Vikrant Gupta (@vikrantgupta73) March 19, 2016
6.4 overs: 10 runs off this over so far. This over has been productive for India. These two shouldn't do anything rash here.
6.3 overs: Four! This time it's Yuvraj. A good cover-drive. Mohammad Amir tries his best but couldn't stop the ball from reaching the fence. Pressure on Sami here. IND 37/3
6.1 overs: Four! Cracking shot! Virat stays on the back-foot and eases the ball past the point fielder. IND 32/3
The required run-rate is 7.58 now. India need a solid stand here. They have men who can finish the game, But the middle order should stand up. They need 91 from 72
6 overs: Five runs from Afridi's first over. IND 28/3
5.5 overs: A couple of wides from Afridi. The ball is spinning a lot.
5.1 overs: Shahid Afridi into the attack. He should be effective on this track. Ind 25/3
India have been reduced to 23/3 in 4.5 overs. Sami was struggling to get the ball right in the first two balls and now he has taken two in two.
4.4 overs: WICKET! Two in two for Sami. Suresh Raina loses his leg-stump. Sami on-a-hat-trick
4.3 overs: WICKET! Sami has beaten Dhawan with pace here. Bog blow for India. India 23/2, chasing 119
4.1 overs: FOUR! Sami in the attack and gives some room outside the off-stump and Dhawan punishes that.
3 overs: End of a brilliant over from Mohammad Amir. Two runs and a wicket from his over. IND 16/1
Rohit Sharma was looking to go over the in-field. He was trying to take the game away from Pakistan early on.
2.1 overs: WICKET! Rohit Sharma departs for 10. This is a massive blow for India at the top. The ball went high in the air and Shoib Malik did well there to hold on to it. IND 14/1
1.5 overs: Four! Rohit pulls 0ne to the boundary. This is a good start for Team India. IND 13/1
1.1 overs: Four! Wide and short from Mohammad Ifran and Rohit is too good for these, smashes to the point boundary. IND 8/0
1 overs: Mohammad Amir bowls a tidy over to start the proceedings for Pakistan. IND 4/0
0.3 overs: Amir has already beaten Rohit once. Indian batsmen have to apply themselves on this wicket
0.1 overs: The Indian innings is underway. Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan are out in the middle. Mohammad Amir has the new ball in his hands

Ashwin and Nehra were brilliant for India with the ball today. The fielding was also good. It's very important to cut down on extra runs on these tracks. Pakistan batsmen batted with sense today. Malik provided the necessary push for the team. It will be an interesting chase here at the Eden Gardens. Join us in a short while..
Maxwell is impressed by Jadeja's work on the field

On a side note, gotta admit I love watching Jadeja field when im not playing against him! Moves fast across the ground and has an #armcannon

— Glenn Maxwell (@Gmaxi_32) March 19, 2016

Both the teams seem to have misread the pitch. Pakistan are playing four seamers on this track. Will it help them? We saw India missing an extra spinner there. Strange Dhoni didn't give Ashwin an extra over, neither did he use Yuvraj Singh there. It's going to be tough for India.

India need 119 to register their first win at this year's ICC World Twenty20 at home. Looking at how the track behaved, the Indian batsmen have be on top of their game to gun down this total. They need to score at 6.56 runs an over on this track
18 overs: Bumrah finishes off with a good over conceding only seven runs off it. Pakistan finish with 118/5 on the board. The Indian batsmen have their task cut out on this pitch
17.4 overs: Bumrah has been brilliant so far with his slower balls. Five runs so far. PAK 116/5
16.2 overs: WICKET! The danger man Shoaib Malik departs. Nehra removes Malik with a slower ball.
16 overs: End of a successful over for India. PAK 103/4 with two more overs to go
15.5 overs: Wicket! Jadeja removes Akmal for 21 (16). Akmal tried to cut the ball one to see the ball going to Dhoni's gloves. PAK 101/4
15.3 overs: Four! Malik at it again. He sweeps one to the mid-wicket boundary to bring up Pakistan's  hundred PAK 101/3
The last two overs have been very good for Pakistan. Their run-rate now is 6.26 and on this pitch anything over six would be a nightmare for the chasing team
15 overs: Dot ball to finish another expensive over. 13 runs off it. Pak 95/3
14.5 overs: Four! One more from Malik. Poor bowling from Bumrah, he has not been able to get the yorker right.
14.4 overs: Four! Malik is on fire. Slashes Bumrah to the cover boundary. The ball raised to the boundary ropes. Pak 91/3
14.2 overs: Well bowled by Bumrah. He fired it wide and Malik could afford only a single
14.1 overs: No ball! Bumrah had overstepped. This is a free-hit. Good opportunity for Malik to make things worse

13.6 overs: SIX! This time, it's Umar Akmal. Not-so-clever bowling from Pandya. This one was a pitched short and Akmal just had to slash his bat across the line. 15 runs off this over. Might prove to be costly in the end. PAK 82/3
13.4 overs: SIX! Shoib Malik hits the first six of the Pakistan's innings. He deposits one into the stands. PAK 75/3
13 overs: Tidy over Nehra, two runs off it. Pakistan are 67/3. How much would India want to chase on this track? Remember Pakistan have a wrist-spinner in Afridi
It was Amithab Bachchan who sang the national anthem today

The #IND National Anthem sung by @SrBachchan ahead of #INDvPAK #WT20https://t.co/NdXaA7665y

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
12 overs: It was turning out to be a good over for India but Jadeja's throw cost India five extra runs. Pakistan 65/3
11.5 overs: WICKET! Pandya removes Afridi for 8 and Pakistan are 60/3. Do they have a target in mind for India? The pitch, we repeat, is turning square.
11.2 overs: Pandya in the attack and FOUR! Umar Aknal punishes a rank poor delivery. As it should have been
10.2 overs: It's turning more at the Eden than it did at Jamtha, feels Wasim Akram.
10 overs: Pakistan 51/2, with 8 overs to go.
9.3 overs: FOUR! Boom, boom Afridi goes after Bumrah and he sends that to the fence. The Eden is stunned into silence again. Emotions swinging like a pendulum here tonight
9.2 overs: WICKET! Bumrah has removed Shehzad for 25. This was an important strike for India. Pakistan 42/2
9.1 overs: FOUR! Shehzad works on the pace and places that one from Bumrah nicely. Easy pickings for Pakistan
9 overs: Good over from Jadeja as Pakistan reach 42/1. But like Wasim Akram said, it's an almost unplayable pitch,
8 overs: Pakistan 39/1 - the big news is that Shahid Afridi has come out to bat at N0.3
7.4 overs: WICKET! Sharjeel falls to Raina, thanks to a stunning catch by Pandya. Pakistan 38/1
7.1 overs: No surprises here. Raina in the attack. India have no extra spinner. Wonder why Harbhajan Singh is not playing in place of Hardik Pandya
7 overs: Jadeja troubled Shehzad with his turn and bounce but Pakistan are 34/0 on a rank turner. How much would India like to chase here?
6.4 overs: FOUR! Lucky runs for Shehzad and Pakistan would be happy to take that.
6.1 overs: Ravindra Jadeja in the attack early
6 overs: Four runs off the over. Pakistan 28/0 after the powerplay. This pitch is turning square
5.1 overs: Ashwin to bowl his third one here. This looks like another rank-turner
5 overs: FOUR! After struggling to put bat to ball for three balls, Sharjeel hammers it to the fence. Cracking shot. Pakistan 24/0
4.2 overs: Sharjeel struggling with his timing. He is looking uncomfortable.
4.1 overs: Bowling change. Bumrah replaces Nehra in the attack.
4 overs: Big turn and bounce from Ashwin. Pakistan 19/0
Ahmed Shehzad brings up 1000 runs in T20 Internationals
3.3 overs: FOUR! Shehzad steps down the track to kill the spin and the ball races away to the fence. The Eden is silent
3.1 overs: Ashwin to continue and Shehzad picks a quick single
3 overs: First boundary of the innings. Sharjeel picks up the first poor delivery from Nehra and the ball reaches the ropes. Pakistan 12/0
2.5 overs: Good fielding by Raina and there's a cheer, a loud cheer.
2 overs: Excellent over from Ashwin. Turn and bounce already. Just two off the over.
1.4 overs: Just the single from Ashwin so far. India are looking sharp tonight
1.2 overs: Ashwin in the attack and he gets immediate turn. Go India!
1 overs: Good start from Nehra! He almost got a wicket there with a slower ball. Shehzad was bamboozled. PAK 3/0
0.3 overs: Sharjeel hits one straight to the point fielder. PAK 2/0
Ashish Nehra has the new ball. He is looking all set. Sharjeel Khan and Ahmed Shehzad are at the crease for Pakistan
The feel is electric at the Eden Gardens. Amithab Bachchan rendered the Indian national anthem
The two teams are walking out for the national anthems. Sourav Ganguly led the way with the World T20 trophy in his hand. Mamata Banerjee is also there
Brian Lara says the par score here is 170. 18 overs, 170, What do you people think?

170runs https://t.co/YJ3oVcFrrS

— Brian Lara (@BrianLara) March 19, 2016
Here's a look at the playing XIs
India: Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, Yuvraj Singh, MS Dhoni(w/c), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Ashish Nehra, Jasprit Bumrah
Pakistan: Sharjeel Khan, Ahmed Shehzad, Mohammad Hafeez, Umar Akmal, Shoaib Malik, Sarfraz Ahmed(w), Shahid Afridi(c), Wahab Riaz, Mohammad Sami, Mohammad Amir, Mohammad Irfan
It's a good call to bowl first, because the pitch was covered, but now we have to put a decent total on the board: Shahid Afridi
Past doesn't really matter, but as far as cricket is concerned, you have to be at your best on that particular day, adds Dhoni
The wicket has been under the covers for quite some time, so it might be a bit sticky: Dhoni at the toss
"Pakistan's strength is fast bowling," says Dhoni.
TOSS: India have won the toss and have opted to bowl first against Pakistan. Team unchanged
Team huddle ahead of the toss

Team #IND huddle - atmosphere building up like crazy! #INDvPAK #WT20 https://t.co/wvuFOrWGSM

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
The two captain Shahid Afridi and MS Dhoni are walking out for the toss..
It's now confirmed! Toss in five-minutes time. The players are warming up at the Edens
The match will start at 20.30 IST: Reports
Toss will happen at 20.10 IST, it will be 18 overs per-side, according to reports
Thank you for the reception. Hope it's a great game today, Imran Khan said at Eden Gardens
No news on the toss yet, no official update
Now the players are out on the field practising

Thank you so much for organising the big event in Kolkata. We'll give the necessary security for the matches in Kolkata: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee
No updates on the toss yet.  As we said earlier we'll lose overs from 20.15 IST

The covers have been removed from the ground. The umpires are out on the field
Meanwhile, we will start losing overs in the men's game if the match doesn't start by 20.15 IST. The cut-off time for a 5-over shootout is 22.20 IST.
Pakistan women have won the game by two runs (D/L)
It's all over at Kotla. The game between Pakistan women and India has been called off. Pakistan women were 77/6 chasing 97 against India women after rain interrupted play.
Good news! The covers are being removed from the ground. Sourav Ganguly is out on the field and having a chat with one of the groundsmen.

Cut-off time here in Delhi is 6.50pm. If there's no more cricket, then Pakistan win the match on the DLS by being 2 runs ahead. #WT20

— Alan Wilkins (@alanwilkins22) March 19, 2016
The crowd is making noise as the central covers are being removed again. There's no update on the toss yet
I have to lead the attack. I do well in big games, says Pakistan pacer Wahab Riaz at Eden Gardens
While we bring you updates on rain at Eden and Kotla, have a look at the teams' dressing rooms.

Rain has stopped the play between India women and Pakistan in Delhi. Pakistan women are two runs ahead according to D/L. Pak Wn 77/6 in 16 overs chasing 97 at the Kotla. Seems more covers are being brought in
Amithab Bachchan is at the Eden Gardens for singing India's national anthem..

Brilliant to have @SrBachchan & @ShafqatAmanatA alongside @SGanguly99 here at Eden Gardens #INDvPAK #WT20 pic.twitter.com/MfcxYMim5m

Suresh Raina and Ravindra Jadeja are watching the ground staff at action. They are removing the water off the covers and yeah the covers are still on
Light drizzle at Eden. It has nearly stopped. The Super Soppers are at work.
Latest images coming from Eden Gardens show light drizzle on and the entire ground under covers.
It has gone dark again at the Eden, says Shivani Gupta from Kolkata
No! The rain gods aren't showing mercy here. After things were improving, it has again started raining at the Eden Gardens.

HUGE forks of lightning and claps of thunder around the ground here in Kolkata #INDvPAK #WT20 https://t.co/kXftEPXUYD

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
Both teams have some records to maintain today. Pakistan have never lost at Eden Gardens and India have never lost against their arch rivals in a World T20 game
The central covers are being removed from the ground. Fingers crossed!

Meanwhile, the intensity of the rain has started to reduce at the Eden Gardens. The ground staff are clearing the water off the central covers. Good news is that the sky is clearing. We're 75 minutes away from the toss and Eden's new drainage system should do the job if there is no more rain
Pakistan legend Wasim Akram wants Afridi to be calm at the Eden Gardens. "If Afridi is calm, the entire team is calm," he says.
Pakistan are looking good having beaten Bangladesh by a big margin in their opening clash. Their skipper Shahid Afridi's boom-boom knock should have given a lot of encouragement for the team.
Thoughts on a rail-curtailed game? Advantage Pakistan?
Big news coming in. Bangladesh's Tasking Ahmed and Arafat Sunny suspended from bowling in international cricket due to illegal action
World Cup-winning skipper Imran Khan has landed in Kolkata. He has met the Pakistan team. A couple of words from the legend should help the in-form Pakistan team
It isn't looking good at Eden.. Check out these photos

The scene at Eden Gardens currently as the clouds overhead threaten rain ? Hopefully clearing up soon #INDvPAK #WT20 pic.twitter.com/GFlidmOXro

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
Not good news coming from the Eden Gardens. It' has been  since the morning and the rain got a bit heavier now. Not just the pitch, but the entire ground has been covered

India need to win today to stay alive in the tournament after their shock defeat against New Zealand. India also have the burden of records and history to look after - they have never lost to Pakistan in World Cups and World T20s.
Hello and Welcome to the Live Coverage of the big-ticket clash at the Eden Gardens

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: Pakistan batted calmly on a tricky wicket to post 118/5 in 18 overs against India at the Eden Gardens  (Live Scorecard)
